title: Weekly Executive Aviation Briefing
subtitle: Global aviation industry updates and analysis

top_developments.title: U.S. Aviation System Under Unprecedented Strain
top_developments.description: FAA mandated escalating flight cuts of up to 10% at major airports amid a government shutdown, causing mass cancellations and chaos.

top_developments.title: FAA Grounds Entire MD-11 Fleet After Fatal Crash
top_developments.description: FAA issued an emergency directive grounding all MD-11s after a deadly UPS freighter crash during takeoff.

top_developments.title: Spirit Airlines Secures Critical Labor Agreements
top_developments.description: Spirit Airlines reached cost-saving deals with pilot and flight attendant unions amid Chapter 11 bankruptcy.

top_developments.title: JFK's New Terminal One Pioneers Pooled Electric GSE
top_developments.description: New York JFK’s new terminal will deploy a common-use, all-electric ground support fleet, a first for North America.

top_developments.title: FedEx Accelerates Sustainability Goals with SAF Expansion
top_developments.description: FedEx began using Sustainable Aviation Fuel at major U.S. hubs as part of its 2030 sustainability target.

top_developments.title: IAG to Equip 500+ Aircraft with Free Starlink Wi-Fi
top_developments.description: IAG and SpaceX reached an agreement to install Starlink broadband across IAG’s fleet for free passenger access.

top_developments.title: Aircraft Leasing Market Surges Amid Production Delays
top_developments.description: Air Lease Corp posted strong profits and raised outlook ahead of a $7.4B investor-led acquisition.

top_developments.title: Zero-Emission Aviation Advances with EU-Funded Hydrogen Project
top_developments.description: ZeroAvia secured €21.4M EU grant to retrofit 15 aircraft and build hydrogen-electric cargo infrastructure in Norway.

regional_overviews.title: North America
regional_overviews.description: The U.S. faced massive disruptions due to the FAA-mandated flight cuts from the government shutdown, while sustainability and partnership initiatives like JFK’s electric GSE and FedEx’s SAF expansion progressed.

regional_overviews.title: Europe
regional_overviews.description: Europe advanced hydrogen-electric projects and carbon neutrality efforts while facing risks from drone disruptions and labor disputes.

regional_overviews.title: Asia-Pacific
regional_overviews.description: Asia-Pacific recovery accelerated with IndiGo-China Southern partnership, increased leasing, and airport AI-driven innovations.

regional_overviews.title: Middle East
regional_overviews.description: The region saw major growth led by Emirates Group profits, Baghdad Airport modernization, and vertiport initiatives in Abu Dhabi.

regional_overviews.title: Africa
regional_overviews.description: Nigeria’s Air Peace secured the first dry-lease aircraft in nearly a decade as the region advanced green airport operations.
